intro: Swertia sulcata, commonly known as the African violet, is a perennial herb native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Gentianaceae and is characterized by its upright, branched stems and opposite, ovate leaves. Swertia sulcata is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its attractive foliage and flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers partial shade to full sun.
